Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell Culture and Protein Expression Analysis

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 mutation (NM_017636.3:c.925G>A) led to reduced mitochondrial function.
SNCA mutation (NM_000340.2:c.67C>T) caused abnormal protein aggregation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in three independent biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1, LRRK2, and SNCA constructs were used as controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfections were included as negative controls.

Additional controls.Description: Sham-treated cells and non-transfected cells were included for comparison.

Assay specificity.Description: Specific antibodies and siRNA knockdown were used to confirm results.

Quantification method.Description: Protein levels were quantified using densitometry and ELISA.

Statistical analysis.Description: Results were analyzed using ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test.

Reproducibility.Description: All experiments were repeated at least three times with consistent results.

Approved by.Description: The manuscript was accepted for publication after peer review.

Funding source.Description: The research was supported by NIH grants R01NS098789 and R21NS107876.

Conflict of interest.Description: The authors declare no competing financial interests.

Data availability.Description: Raw data and analysis scripts are available at the NIH Data Sharing Repository (DOI: 10.12345/nihr001).

Ethical compliance.Description: All experiments were conducted in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki.
